definition: overflowing/excessive/indiscriminate
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
supervisor
to supervise/to inspect/jail/prison
to misuse/to abuse
to be in flood/to overflow (the banks)/to inundate/to spread unchecked
abuse of power
to bomb indiscriminately
lit. to flood (idiom)/fig. rampant/in plague proportions
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to denude/illegal logging/forest clearance
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
cliché/commonplace/truism/stereotype
better to have nothing (than substandard choice) (idiom); would prefer to go without than accept shoddy option
same as 寧缺毋濫|宁缺毋滥[ning4 que1 wu2 lan4]
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
to fall into bad company/to make acquaintances indiscriminately
hackneyed talk/platitude
indiscriminately included in company (without any qualification)/see 濫竽充數|滥竽充数[lan4 yu2 chong1 shu4]

sentences.english: This is a topic of overcharging , said, but in fact it is difficult to answer.
sentences.chinese: 虽然这是一个说滥了的题目，但其实很难回答。

sentences.english: You can't be happy by doing something groovy.
sentences.chinese: 怎么可能快乐阿，干这么滥的活。

sentences.english: The word 'new' has really been flogged to death in advertisements, and nobody believes it any more.
sentences.chinese: “新式”这个词在广告里都用滥了，没人再相信了。

sentences.english: We resolutely rectified and standardized the order in the management of mineral resources and put an end to unauthorized mining.
sentences.chinese: 坚决整顿和规范矿产资源管理秩序，制止乱采滥挖。

sentences.english: Have but few friend, though much acquaintance.
Administrative licence set up too many hinder the development of market economy.
sentences.chinese: 行政许可设置过多过滥，阻碍了市场经济的发展。

sentences.english: The  idiom was overworn by my family.
sentences.chinese: 在我们家这条成语都被用滥了。

sentences.english: Throw away any thought you may have of icons being overshot and overdone.
sentences.chinese: 抛弃你那些觉得这些景点已经被拍滥了的想法吧。

sentences.english: Let's take a closer look at tattling .
sentences.chinese: 让我们进一步观察滥告状的行为。

sentences.english: Unfair or abusive treatment and training will lead to an Akita that resents you.
sentences.chinese: 不公平或过滥的对待训练会导致她记恨你。

sentences.english: Too much information may make marketing staff not know which to select .
sentences.chinese: 信息过多过滥也会使得营销人员无所适从。

sentences.english: He prostituted his abilities by acting in television advertisements.
sentences.chinese: 他凭着自己的才能为别人滥拍电视广告。

sentences.english: Primitive societies administered such symbolic punishments freely.
sentences.chinese: 在初民社会中，这种符号性惩罚用得很滥。

sentences.english: If you overcharge, the efficiency of the batteries will also be affected.
sentences.chinese: 如果你滥，电池的效率也会受影响。

sentences.english: It's the lamest thing. I never wanted to be associated with it.
sentences.chinese: 它还真是有够滥的，我再也不想跟它扯上关系。

sentences.english: His wife lavished money upon household appliances.
sentences.chinese: 他妻子在家用电器上的滥花钱。

definition: fickle in love/sentimentality
same as 寧缺毋濫|宁缺毋滥[ning4 que1 wu2 lan4]
better to have nothing (than substandard choice) (idiom); would prefer to go without than accept shoddy option
to fall into bad company/to make acquaintances indiscriminately
bad habit/evil custom/vulgarity
do not
(dialect) no good/(contraction of 不 and 好)/see 孬種|孬种[nao1 zhong3]
rotten to the core
lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
dirty/filthy/base/mean/narrow-minded/petty
intolerable/unacceptable
to waste/to spoil/to destroy/to insult grievously
cliché/commonplace/truism/stereotype
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to ill-use/to humiliate/to degrade/to ruin/also pr. [zuo2 jian4]
variant of 糟蹋[zao1 ta4]
